column1: We owe our heroic frontline workers including our health care professionals more than our thanks for their tireless work during this pandemic.   Let’s all do our part to stop the spread of #COVID19 not only this holiday weekend but in the weeks ahead.

To all celebrating Thanksgiving without family & friends: I know it's tough.   To all who've lost a loved one to COVID & have an empty seat at their table: I know it's tougher.   To our essential workers: I'm grateful & know your work doesn't stop.   To all: have a safe holiday.
As cases continue to rise we can each take steps to help prevent the spread of #COVID19:    😷 Wear a mask   🙌 🧼Wash your hands for at least 20 seconds   🧍------ 6ft ------🧍Practice social distancing

Staggering and heartbreaking. We must not become numb as the death toll continues to increase. Every person lost to #COVID19 is more than a number they were someone’s loved one. It’s up to every one of us to play a role in stopping the spread of this pandemic. https://t.co/sYgUGEhJFG

As #COVID19 cases continue to rise in Michigan it's now more important than ever to make sure you have health insurance.    Open enrollment is now underway until December 15 📅!    Visit https://t.co/vGzy5eRNAi for more information and #GetCovered today.

It’s always a pleasure to join the Council of Baptist Pastors of Detroit & Vicinity. I’ll continue fighting for the issues impacting our communities like the need to pass #COVID19 relief protecting pre-existing conditions & passing the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act. https://t.co/ZdrnYLrCav

With the surge in #COVID19 cases here in Michigan and across the country it is absolutely critical that each and every one of us do our part to stop the spread of this virus. #MaskUpMichigan https://t.co/w0sjPHjBb7

There’s no question COVID-19 continues to hit Michigan hard. It’s past time Congress passes and enacts bipartisan meaningful relief for families small businesses workers schools hospitals health professionals & communities. I remain ready to work together to achieve that.

To contain #COVID19 we need a strong national coordinated effort with doctors public health experts and epidemiologists that is guided by science and facts.  President-elect Biden’s announcement today shows he will treat this pandemic with the seriousness it demands. https://t.co/356BoFvhrR

This is encouraging progress. I’m proud of all the Michiganders supporting this effort at the Pfizer facility in Portage. As I’ve said we must ensure eventual Coronavirus vaccines are safe effective free and widely available for all Michiganders and Americans. https://t.co/75KJPBgnbU

Quality health care is more important now than ever before. Michiganders w/ pre-existing conditions—including those who contracted #COVID19—need affordable care.   The Trump Admin must end their support for the reckless lawsuit that could end these protections and raise costs.

As Ranking Member of @HSGAC I’ll fight to ensure eventual Coronavirus vaccines are safe effective free and widely available for all Michiganders and Americans.  Read my new report ⬇️ https://t.co/9GTOGEiG9B

#COVID19 has forced more of our interactions to take place online so we need to protect against threats to our electric grid telecommunications networks & air travel. My bipartisan bill to predict severe space weather events & mitigate their harmful impacts on Earth is now law. https://t.co/eUU6ZVruyz

Michiganders with pre-existing conditions need access to quality & affordable health care—including those who have contracted #COVID19. The Trump Admin. needs to drop their support of the reckless lawsuit that could threaten Michiganders' access to health care & raise costs. https://t.co/6UM6MeONwt

Development of #COVID19 vaccine must be rooted in science and transparency so we can be sure that it will be safe.   That is why I am pressing @SteveFDA on how his agency will ensure a vaccine is safe for older Americans who have been disproportionately harmed by the pandemic. https://t.co/6XImUFnb6R

I have heard from families workers small business owners and community leaders who are still facing serious challenges because of the #COVID19 pandemic.  We need to come together to pass comprehensive bipartisan relief so Michiganders can get the help they need NOW. https://t.co/jA9XNEyf0m

Due to #COVID19 cash-strapped communities in Michigan are facing serious budget challenges which could affect critical services & force layoffs of first responders & health care professionals.   Let's come together—just as we have before—to pass bipartisan relief for Michigan.

Michiganders w/ pre-existing conditions—including those who have contracted #COVID19—need access to quality affordable health care.  I’m calling on the Trump Admin to drop their support of the reckless lawsuit that will raise costs & end pre-existing conditions protections.

I’ve heard from parents teachers and school administrators across Michigan who are focused on ensuring they have the resources and supplies to keep students connected to a quality education.  We need a bipartisan COVID relief package that supports our students and educators.

Due to #COVID19 cash-strapped communities in #MI are facing serious budget challenges which could affect critical services & force layoffs of:  🚒🚑First responders 👩‍👨‍Health care professionals 🧑‍🏫Teachers  Let's come together—just as we have before—to pass bipartisan relief.

Due to #COVID19 our world has become more digitally interconnected. I’m pleased to see  @MINationalGuard cyber & air component squadrons at Battle Creek have even greater capacity to complete their mission and boost our cyber defenses. Thankful for all they do to keep us safe. https://t.co/aOw4Hv7PHJ

During this pandemic @minurses have been on the frontlines for their neighbors & communities. They deserve our thanks and also need another bipartisan robust COVID relief bill.   I’m fighting to ensure our nurses health care workers & hospitals have more support & resources. https://t.co/QYqeAgcTcb

As I have said it’s past time for Congress to pass meaningful bipartisan COVID relief legislation. Michigan families and workers are hurting including workers in our aviation sector and we must take action to support them.

🚨This is exactly what I’m hearing from Michiganders. They can’t afford to wait any longer for meaningful COVID relief. It's disappointing & reckless the President walked away.  Let’s get to work on a bipartisan deal for families workers small businesses schools & communities. https://t.co/32eWNQTZ1g

Michigan can’t wait! This is unacceptable.   I still stand ready to hammer out a comprehensive—and bipartisan—COVID relief deal for Michigan families workers & small businesses.   We’ve done this before—we can do it again. That needs to be our focus NOW. https://t.co/RTQhWINhgS https://t.co/rmUA5KjaPS

The #COVID19 pandemic is not over. Michigan families workers small businesses schools & communities are struggling each & every day. We need to come together to pass meaningful bipartisan comprehensive relief.  Let’s roll up our sleeves and get to work–just as we have before.
We all must do our part to help stop the spread of COVID-19.    It’s important to social distance & please don’t forget to #MaskUpMichigan. https://t.co/Kc0YGVwJjI

As @hsgac Ranking Member I participated on Wednesday in a committee markup where I was seated near Chairman Ron Johnson who announced today he tested positive for COVID-19. I’m feeling great & have no symptoms but I am responsibly following protocols including getting tested.

Wearing a mask is an important step we can all take to ensure we’re protecting our loved ones and those around us from spreading #COVID19.  We’re in this together so let’s #MaskUpMichigan. https://t.co/Qu9rbjQhMA

Colleen and I are thinking of the President and First Lady after hearing the awful news. We wish them a speedy full recovery.   Reminder: this pandemic is real and serious. We each have a role to play in preventing the spread of this pandemic. Wear a mask & social distance.

The House again passed COVID relief & as I’ve said the Senate must act on robust legislation. Michigan families small businesses schools & communities need more federal support. The Senate should focus on passing a bipartisan COVID bill—not rushing on the Supreme Court vacancy.

Michigan families right now are worried about putting food on the table and making ends meet. The Senate must focus on passing meaningful bipartisan comprehensive #COVID19 relief.  Unfortunately Senator McConnell is instead trying to jam through a #SCOTUS nominee. https://t.co/9HPvk2skaH

Small & medium-sized manufacturers have faced significant challenges due to the #COVID19 pandemic.   I’m working in a bipartisan way to help Michigan manufacturers expand growth maintain staff & adapt to market these changes. https://t.co/r3FeZkQtxW

Instead of jamming through a #SCOTUS nominee we should focus on passing meaningful bipartisan coronavirus relief for Michigan. This pandemic is still hurting Michigan families & small businesses.   We’ve come together before on a bipartisan basis to pass aid—let’s do so again. https://t.co/CYi8kv5ZQG

Tragically COVID-19 has claimed over 200000 Americans' lives including nearly 7000 Michiganders. No words can ease the grief of their loved ones or fill the voids in our communities.  As we move forward we all can play a role to prevent the spread of COVID. #MaskUpMichigan

So proud of all that @MINationalGuard is doing -- from leading COVID response to keeping us safe. This announcement builds on Michigan's growing defense footprint. I'll continue to support their work through the Armed Services Committee. https://t.co/jW6LZnxRiE
The world has changed dramatically in the last 19 years but we face persistent security threats old and new—foreign terrorism domestic terrorism cyber-attacks and now the Coronavirus pandemic.

As the Senate returns we need to work in a bipartisan way to pass meaningful #COVID19 relief to support hardworking families workers small businesses & schools.   We also need to ensure @USPS has the support it needs to provide timely reliable service to Americans everywhere.

In communities across Michigan folks are pitching in to help their neighbors make it through this pandemic.  I’m fighting to pass my #COVIDHeroesFund proposal so people like Michelle—who went back to nursing after the pandemic hit—can get extra compensation for her sacrifice. https://t.co/PeNWrs94wk

I’m fighting to pass my #COVID19HeroesFund proposal so workers in the hotel industry like Carrie can receive extra compensation for the risks they’re taking during this pandemic. https://t.co/Px3559ct1R

Working at a busy airport can be stressful during a pandemic & puts workers like Astana at a higher risk.   She deserves more than our thanks—she deserves compensation pay. My #COVID19HeroesFund proposal will reward frontline workers. https://t.co/eX1u5bwf7j

Make sure you stay up to date with the latest news on how I'm working to:   😷 address the Coronavirus pandemic 📬 protect the Postal Service 🏘️ fight for Michigan families   Subscribe to my newsletter here: ⬇️ https://t.co/ASy4wudkBy

⏰WE’RE LIVE IN 15 MINUTES⏰   As Ranking Member of @HSGAC I’m looking into how recent changes to @USPS mail delivery are affecting Michiganders who rely on mail now more than ever due to #COVID19.   I'll be questioning the Postmaster General live in 15 minutes. https://t.co/Fpm4daoKP2

Leader McConnell should call the Senate back into session this week so we can work in a bipartisan manner to pass urgently needed COVID relief and postal legislation. This is about the well being and livelihood of Michiganders.

I applaud @GovWhitmer’s announcement. If you need a free mask call the COVID-19 Hotline at 888-535-6136 or visit https://t.co/tZZ0zW7qEQ to find your nearest Community Action Agency. #MaskUpMichigan https://t.co/3qAweQ8k0J

Like many Michigan small businesses BAJ Glass has stepped in during this pandemic. They’ve produced face masks which have been vital.  Enjoyed visiting them in Flushing & discussing the need to ensure more support for Michigan small businesses as part of #COVID19 relief efforts. https://t.co/yFh5zCUMuH

The Senate needs to be in session working on #COVID19 relief for Michigan families schools workers and small businesses.   Extremely disappointed that the Senate adjourned without addressing the crisis at-hand. https://t.co/g01xaYoKeP

Due to #COVID19 we have become increasingly more interconnected & it's critical we make sure those networks are secure.  My bipartisan bill would help secure our telecommunications networks from adversaries like the Chinese government & strengthen the network security for #MI. https://t.co/3lf5tFjlYf

We are facing the worst public health and economic crisis in generations and the President’s actions fall way short of what Michigan families and small businesses urgently need.   My statement on the President's Coronavirus executive actions: https://t.co/qkF7ILvfUD

Leader McConnell’s HEALS Act simply doesn’t cut it for Michigan.   We need more assistance to families cash-strapped communities that provide critical services & are key to COVID-19 response efforts funding for more robust testing—all things the HEALS Act *doesn’t* do. https://t.co/jdX2XOdUPI

There's no deal on the next COVID-19 bill. Leader McConnell should bring the Senate back now & we should keep working on a deal until we pass a bipartisan package. Michiganders expect us to roll up our sleeves & work together which I remain ready to do.  Read our letter here ⬇️ https://t.co/My0cUkL6Lr

Thank you to the #MI Assoc of Administrators of Special Education for sharing stories on the need to fund special education increase mental health resources & to address educator shortages.   I'm working to support schools & students w/ disabilities in the next #COVID19 package. https://t.co/LLG3KH8qWr

Michigan small businesses need more help to weather this unprecedented crisis.  The bipartisan RESTART Act would provide support to the hardest hit small & mid-sized businesses. I’m pushing for this bill to be included in the next #COVID19 relief package.https://t.co/2RIIYAYBUK

The Coronavirus pandemic has shown that protecting our medical supply chain is vitally important.   As Ranking Member of @HSGAC I authored language to protect our medical supply chain from vulnerabilities and security risks. https://t.co/7fCd7wD6GX

Front line workers don't have the luxury of being able to work from home. They risk their health & safety stepping up to care for & serve their fellow citizens.  I’m fighting to pass my #COVID19HeroesFund so #MI workers like Cory can get extra compensation for their sacrifices. https://t.co/c8VdMokJmt

Small businesses in #MI like Total Plastics have stepped up to help w/ #COVID19 response efforts. Great being there today to see their amazing work.   Small businesses are the backbone of our economy—I’ll keep fighting for strong federal support in the next relief package. https://t.co/QDHK24PN5d

Front line workers in #MI have worked overtime & gone the extra mile to keep caring for patients during #COVID19.  These brave workers who knowingly put their own health & safety at risk - like Jen & her colleagues - should be compensated for their sacrifices. #COVID19HeroesFund https://t.co/nv5PmsbWaY

Coronavirus has exposed vulnerabilities in our supply chain & my National Institute of Manufacturing Act aims to reduce our reliance on foreign manufacturers & shore up our critical manufacturing capabilities in #MI.  Read more from @MiningJournal ⬇️. https://t.co/zRpoaJzvOP

Front line workers across Michigan have answered the call to give back to their community even if that means risking their own health and safety.  Michiganders like Tyler should be compensated for their sacrifice & that's why I'm fighting to pass my #COVID19HeroesFund. https://t.co/Zqz0uyEbii

To reopen our economy and for parents to return to work we must address the child care crisis while prioritizing the health & safety of children and child care workers. The Senate should include the Child Care is Essential Act in the next COVID relief package. #SaveChildCare

There is no doubt small businesses in Michigan have been hit hard by the COVID-19 pandemic but they’re resilient.    It was great touring Grand Traverse Distillery yesterday and seeing the work they’re doing produce hand sanitizer for Michiganders. https://t.co/NP5akjCng2

It was an honor meeting frontline workers at Munson Medical Center.  I’ll keep fighting to increase access to testing and supplies secure more funding for hospitals--including in rural communities-- & pass my #COVID19HeroesFund to give essential workers premium pandemic pay. https://t.co/Zks1q6uK7i
I’m going to continue working to support small businesses – like TentCraft – as the Senate considers the next phase of Coronavirus relief.

Enjoyed meeting with the @TentCraft team and touring their facility in Traverse City.   They’ve contributed to #COVID19 response by making medical tents for drive-thru testing sites and other medical facilities. Proud of them – and all small biz in #MI that have stepped up. https://t.co/PmvIa5q0wI

The Coronavirus pandemic has taken an emotional and financial toll on doctors nurses and health care professionals across Michigan & the U.S.   I’m fighting to pass my #COVID19HereosFund so Michiganders serving the front lines like Richard are compensated for their sacrifices. https://t.co/APTfUqHTWQ

The #COVID19 pandemic has exposed serious vulnerabilities and security risks within the medical and manufacturing supply chain in the U.S.   Watch to see how my National Institute of Manufacturing Act would help address these concerns and bring jobs back to Michigan. #NIM https://t.co/Me61JeWRI2

While front line workers continue to risk their health & safety I have a plan to reward them for their hard work & sacrifice during this pandemic.  Proud to have @UFCW876's support for my #COVID19HeroesFund which would provide premium pay to reward & retain essential workers. https://t.co/3VCiBPpUaH

Workers across Michigan have been on the front lines – day in and day out – putting themselves at risk so Michigan families and communities can make it through this pandemic.   See why @MIAFLCIO is calling for the Senate to advance the #COVID19HeroesFund. https://t.co/8kXUjBiTsU

Underserved communities in #MI & across the U.S. continue to be disproportionately impacted by #COVID19.  I’m working to ensure all Michiganders including African American & Latino communities get the resources needed during this pandemic & that we address health disparities. https://t.co/B0P6pZ9pIf

Families workers and small businesses across Michigan are still grappling with #COVID19 & there is more work to be done.    The Senate should not adjourn for two weeks and instead stay in session to deal with this unprecedented economic and health crisis!

Workers on the front lines have been risking their health & safety so all of us can make it through this pandemic.   Now we need to make sure we have their backs.  Proud to have the support of Nia and @unitehere Local 24 for my #COVID19HeroesFund proposal. https://t.co/Ce1JknKsj8

Firefighters continue to honor their commitment to protect & serve their communities during this public health crisis.   David President of Michigan Association of Fire Chiefs agrees we need to pass my #COVID19HeroesFund proposal to support the first responders risking so much. https://t.co/AzpqSRPNpI

Appreciated the opportunity to participate in a virtual town hall today with @alzmichigan answering questions and giving an update on my efforts in the fight to #ENDALZ & ensure Michiganders have the resources they need as we battle #COVID. @alzassociation https://t.co/VuoirHqcYZ

Nurses are not only risking their own health & safety but have to live with the fear of potentially passing COVID-19 to a loved one.  Proud to have the support of @ANAnursesMI for passing my #COVID19HeroesFund so nurses can receive the pandemic compensation they deserve. https://t.co/NPWdRoabha

I’m calling on the Trump Admin. to do the responsible thing and encourage more Coronavirus testing to help slow the spread of COVID-19 & reopen our economy safely.   Threatening to end federal funding or slow down testing is reckless and won’t help get Michiganders back to work. https://t.co/7WUZvBLvm3

With a new school year approaching teachers & school support staff could face higher risk of exposure to COVID-19.  See why @aftmichigan President Dave Hecker says the Senate should pass my #COVID19HeroesFund proposal to support essential workers with pandemic compensation pay. https://t.co/7g7gujh5EC

Hospitals & health care facilities are struggling to keep up w/ the demands of #COVID19 & the Trump Admin has delayed sending these facilities the aid they desperately need.   As Ranking Member of @HSGAC I looked into the impacts of these delays.➡️ https://t.co/BM5bnMxia7

Letter carriers like Ben from Farmington Hills are hard at work making sure Michiganders can get their medicine or receive their mail to pay their bills.    Read his story – and why I’m fighting to pass my #COVID19HeroesFund proposal. https://t.co/OiIRYPFfd4

Our front line workers are having their lives upended due to the Coronavirus all while risking their personal health and the health of their families.   My #COVID19HeroesFund would make sure workers like Jessica receive extra compensation for their sacrifices. https://t.co/2vSwPgyqLl

Linda like many front line workers is making tough sacrifices during this pandemic by staying in a camper between shifts so her husband isn’t exposed to the virus.   My #COVID19HeroesFund proposal would help make sure these front line workers get extra compensation. https://t.co/lzYjU32j1G

As the #COVID19 pandemic continues Michiganders like Martha & her daughter are still facing an increased threat of catching the virus each time they show up to work.  My #COVID19HeroesFund proposal would make sure all front line workers are fairly compensated for the sacrifices. https://t.co/d6tJijmkA9

Everyday heroes are continuing to step up and serve their communities during this pandemic.   People like Dana a single mother of three who is part of Plumbers Local 98 deserve pandemic pay. I’m continuing to push to advance my #COVID19HeroesFund to make it a reality. https://t.co/Rex5zicTfr

Are you a Michigan small business facing challenges because of the Coronavirus pandemic?   Check out my small business guide about the federal resources  that may be available to you. ⬇️ https://t.co/WTn3sUVgFx

Whether serving in uniform abroad on the front lines of the #COVID19 pandemic or in our defense sector Michiganders continue to play a vital role in strengthening our national security.   Click below to learn about my provisions in this year's NDAA. ⬇️ https://t.co/t43v7DmG7A

Small businesses are the engine of our state’s economy & helping them bounce back from the impacts of #COVID19 is critical.  I’ll keep fighting to ensure small business owners across #MI can access the federal resources they need to recover from this crisis. https://t.co/2ftJtRtpkO

Pleased to join @wwcnaacp's virtual event answer questions & give an update on #COVID19 resources racial disparities criminal justice & policing reforms. Great to hear from members & I'll keep working so we can emerge from this economic & health crisis & address inequities.

Very alarmed at reports of domestic violence on the rise during #COVID19 pandemic.  I'm working in a bipartisan way to ensure domestic violence shelters that take pets will receive the resources they need to support survivors. ⬇️ https://t.co/4LpDHcs2Bf

Over 100000 Americans including over 5300 Michiganders have lost their lives to #COVID19.  These were parents siblings sons & daughters.  This gut-wrenching death toll is a stark reminder of the threat we’re still facing.

More work needs to be done so minority communities receive the financial help needed to combat #COVID19.   My bill would support organizations working to help minority small business owners & consumers in communities of color navigate this economic crisis. https://t.co/1BhWxCj1iE

While the Coronavirus pandemic has upended annual traditions of this solemn holiday we cannot forget those who died in service for our nation.   This #MemorialDay please take some time to pay tribute to Michigan’s and our nation’s heroes. https://t.co/sVOi8Mq79T

Truck drivers are going from Point A to Point B – taking every step possible to protect themselves – but still facing risks.   Workers like Bill should get bonus pay for working through this pandemic on the frontlines. My #COVIDHeroesFund proposal would make that possible. https://t.co/6nzRL42qGx

Want to stay up to date on the latest news regarding my work to address the Coronavirus pandemic or efforts in the Senate on behalf of Michigan families?    Subscribe to my newsletter here: ⬇️ https://t.co/ASy4wtVJcY

A recent cyber-attack sponsored by the Chinese government was aimed at stealing COVID-19 treatment and vaccine research.  As Ranking Member of @HSGAC I’m calling on the Administration to take strong action to retaliate against this unacceptable attack. ⬇️ https://t.co/gInscA010p

People across Michigan are relying on truck drivers to deliver food & supplies to their local grocery store so they can make it through this pandemic.  I'm fighting so our front line workers like Jim can be compensated extra for working during this pandemic. #COVID19HeroesFund https://t.co/9TVySpdHS6
As we continue working to address Coronavirus I also pressed for more medical supplies in our state that are vital for ongoing Coronavirus response and testing.
I spoke with @FEMA Region 5 Administrator James Joseph tonight—along with @SenStabenow— about the historic devastating flooding in Mid-Michigan and FEMA Coronavirus response efforts.

As a police officer Brian knows all too well that each time he returns home from working the health of his family could be at risk.   I'll keep pushing for my #COVID19HeroesFund proposal so front line workers like Brian can get compensated for their sacrifice. https://t.co/iKVodXMJFW

We must dramatically increase our testing capabilities and access to testing as we work to safely reopen our economy.   Proud to help secure funding for health centers across Michigan to expand their COVID-19 testing operations including in the UP. https://t.co/GLRNsAtrvm

Our necessary essential workers are risking their health and the health of their families by working on the front lines.   My #COVID19HeroesFund proposal would give these brave workers extra compensation for the sacrifice they’re making during this crisis. https://t.co/jvbFf50eXd

Not only do health care workers like Wendy have to worry about their safety while they’re at work but they could infect their family members when they return home.  My #COVID19HeroesFund would compensate workers like Wendy for the sacrifice they’re making as an essential worker. https://t.co/wamevVTM08

Targeting American research institutions working to find a vaccine for COVID-19 is intolerable.   The Chinese government – and all of our adversaries – must know that we won’t tolerate these attacks on our health care & critical infrastructure systems. https://t.co/cTF7ejTC60

Since daycares are closed because of the pandemic single mothers like Elizabeth have had to juggle the added expense of a babysitter while they go to work.   Learn more about how my #COVID19HeroesFund would help essential workers like Elizabeth during this crisis. https://t.co/kURXYgPHvT

Our front line workers deserve not only our thanks but also extra compensation for their sacrifice.  Enjoyed joining @Ayers4Detroit’s Coffee Hour w/ Detroiters to talk about how my #COVID19HeroesFund proposal would reward front line workers.   Watch more ➡️https://t.co/nZ57b7HjY4 https://t.co/14cNY6DWHt

Grieving families of first responders that have lost a loved one due to #COVID19 should not have to deal w/ bureaucratic red tape to receive survivor benefits. Proud to help pass this bipartisan legislation to help families of fallen first responders in MI.https://t.co/iWldXTpb48

Essential workers in Michigan and across the U.S. are on the front lines helping our communities confront this pandemic.   I’m encouraged the new House Coronavirus package includes a provision based on my Heroes Fund proposal to give frontline workers extra pay. https://t.co/Z3nEyHIFgI

During #MentalHealthMonth and especially during this pandemic it’s critical Michiganders can access mental care services.  Proud to join my friend @SenStabenow who is leading the charge to secure more mental care funding in future #COVID19 bills. #Time2Act #FundMentalHealth

The @BlueAngels will be flying over #Detroit today starting at 11:30 AM to show support for frontline COVID-19 responders.   Make sure you check out the map below! ⬇️ #AmericaStrong https://t.co/ZQsl73Qlhb

By delivering mail during a pandemic Jason is putting himself at risk. Michiganders are relying on him and our postal and delivery workers to receive their prescriptions or connect with their customers.  My #COVID19HeroesFund proposal would help our essential frontline workers. https://t.co/i2Mr2Cty5e

Coronavirus is disproportionally hurting communities of color and exposing systemic barriers that must be addressed.   I’m supporting an effort to establish a federal task force to better understand the impact of the virus on our hardest hit communities and develop solutions. https://t.co/rMyrbhX0QE

As many Michiganders prepare to return to work and small businesses look to reopen we must drastically increase our testing capabilities.  This critical @HHSGov funding I helped secure will allow 39 Michigan health centers to expand COVID-19 testing. https://t.co/VuH48hR392

I’m very troubled by the findings of the @SBAgov Inspector General. Funding should go to small businesses that need it most. I’ll keep fighting to ensure Michigan small businesses receive the support they need & pushing for important oversight of COVID-19 response resources. https://t.co/q5rBBje7RE

My #COVID19HeroesFund would help firefighters like the team Joe represents in Grand Rapids.   Read why compensation pay matters to workers responding to emergencies every day. #Facesofthefrontlines https://t.co/EkpFNuvOq3

I’m pushing for my bipartisan BRAVE Act to be included in future COVID-19 relief legislation.  We need to update & increase VA burial benefits for non-service connected deaths to give veterans the farewell they deserve & bring relief to surviving families. https://t.co/PqoAHCjMCe

Lori has been a nurse for 30+ years—but she’s never seen anything like this.   Nurses are often the last person a patient sees before passing away. This pandemic has put unimaginable stress on them.   That's why I'm fighting to pass my #COVID19HeroesFund. #Facesofthefrontlines https://t.co/5HkhxgMXPP

Every day mail delivery workers nurses bus drivers food supply and grocery store workers are putting their health at risk.   They deserve more than our thanks – they deserve bonus pay. That’s why we must pass my #COVID19HeroesFund proposal.  https://t.co/h3i25PklBo

Scott is a police officer who is still doing his job but facing unprecedented risks to his health.   My #COVID19HeroesFund proposal would make sure he and others on the front lines get compensated extra for their service and sacrifice during this pandemic. #FacesoftheFrontlines https://t.co/dnETXctglc

Our essential workers face the threat of contracting Coronavirus when they show up to work. They should not only be thanked for their sacrifice but compensated.   My #COVID19HeroesFund would do just that for essential workers like Vidalia. #FacesoftheFrontlines https://t.co/BecFdWLFjt
Colleen and I are very relieved to hear that Mayor O'Reilly and his wife Christina recovered from Coronavirus.  https://t.co/L3E3lhq9l4

By providing pandemic premium pay to our front line workers we will not only be able to reward them for their sacrifice but retain and recruit more essential workers.   My #COVID19HeroesFund would help people like Mike better advocate for these workers. #FacesoftheFrontlines https://t.co/tbaJHd8Rmk

As this public health crisis continues the brave men & women of law enforcement play a vital role protecting communities across Michigan.   My #COVID19HeroesFund proposal would ensure those serving on the front lines like Chris receive extra compensation. #FacesoftheFrontlines https://t.co/wxZbkDjzEd
